content: Identify the highest grossing movie of all time that was produced and directed by a female filmmaker. List at least two other movies directed by women that achieved high box office success.

The highest-grossing movie of all time produced and directed by a female filmmaker is "Frozen II," co-directed by Jennifer Lee along with Chris Buck. Jennifer Lee was the chief creative officer for the film, which grossed over $1.45 billion worldwide.

Two other movies directed by women that achieved high box office success are:

1. **"Wonder Woman" (2017)** - Directed by Patty Jenkins, the film grossed over $821 million worldwide and was acclaimed for its groundbreaking portrayal of a female superhero.

2. **"Captain Marvel" (2019)** - Co-directed by Anna Boden and Ryan Fleck, the film grossed over $1.13 billion worldwide, marking a significant achievement for a female-led superhero movie.

These films not only succeeded commercially but also played vital roles in highlighting female leadership in the film industry.
